Class MidiPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • lds.MidiPlayer

  • public class MidiPlayer
extends java.lang.Object
    Consult java.sound.midi and oracle forum

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_INSTRUMENT
      The default instrument to use if one isn't specified in the constructor.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MidiPlayer()
      Create a new MidiPlayer object with a default instrument specified by DEFAULT_INSTRUMENT - usually a piano sound.
      MidiPlayer(int instrument)
      Create a new MidiPlayer object with a specified instrument.

      • setInstrument

        public void setInstrument(int instrument)
        Change the instrument this MidiPlayer uses.
        Parameters:

      • getInstrument

        public int getInstrument()
        Get the instrument the MidiPlayer is using at present.
        Returns:
        the instrument in use.

      • getNumber

        public int getNumber(java.lang.String key)
        Converts a string description of the key to the number used by the MidiPlayer.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the key name is invalid.

      • play

        public void play(int note)
        Play a note - this method doesn't turn the note off after a specified period of time, the release method must be called to do that.
        Parameters:
        note - the note to play

      • release

        public void release(int note)
        Release a note that was previously played. If this note isn't on already, this method will do nothing.

      • play

        public void play(int note,
        int length)
        Play a note for a certain amount of time.
        Parameters:
        note - the integer value for the note to play
        length - the length to play the note (ms).

      • turnAllOff

        public void turnAllOff()
        Release all notes smoothly. This can be called in the World.stopped() method to ensure no notes are playing when the scenario has been stopped or reset.

      • getMidiChannel

        public javax.sound.midi.MidiChannel getMidiChannel()
        Get the MidiChannel object that this MidiPlayer class is using. If you want to do some more advanced work with the midi channel, you can use this method to get the MidiChannel object and then work with it directly. The API for the MidiChannel class is available online as part of the javax.sound.midi package.
        Examples of why you might want to use this - adjusting the speed notes are played / released with, adding sustain, adding pitch bend, soloing / muting individual channels - all are fairly advanced features and as such are not included in this class as standard (to keep things simple and avoid clutter.)
        Returns:
        the MidiChannel object behind this MidiPlayer.

      • playMidiFile

        public static void playMidiFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        Play a Midi file.

      • stopMidiFile

        public static void stopMidiFile()
        Stop playing a Midi file.
